column4: is it even possible to get this usb dongle working with the atmel driver? I'm a bit unsure since the ubuntu site says it should detect it automaticly, while it doesn't when I plug it in
: maybe you have a bad usb, try plugging it into another
considering ubuntu recognizes that i've inserted a device. :)
: there was a guy in here yesterday with usb probs, he had 16 ports and tried forever with the same one, found out it was just bad.

well, I do know that atmel cards really aren't that good in linux generally. I've had to connect wired from this computer every time I've used a linux distro.. It would've been nice to get it working though :p
since everything else works so smoothly
: the bad part is that other people have had it work so easy.
: its not like its known not to work.
true.. :) just hoped someone in here might have some idea how to get the atmel driver to load on the specific device. Since it's not doing so automagically
it shows up under BUs 002, Device 004 on lsusb
: i had a problem with my camera once.. come to find out i didn't have the right permissions for it.

might be that of course.. you never know what might turn up.. I'll have to try to get some hints on where to start, and take it from there. Since the kernel already has atmel precompiled, at least I hopefully wont have to do a kernel recompile to get it running :)
: well to get my camera working i had to find the bus# and the usb # and then type 'chmod go+w /proc/bus/usb/002/008'
: or try a chmod 777 and maybe switch permissions later
